name: vscode-pvs
description: Integrates the PVS theorem proving system into Visual Studio Code
author: Paolo Masci

untrustedWorkspaces.description: vscode-pvs can safely work with untrusted workspaces because it does not attempt to run code the user may have downloaded from untrusted repositories.

notes.description: These contributed settings can be read using vscode.workspace.getConfiguration('pvs')

viewsWelcome.contents:
You have not yet opened a PVS Workspace.
[Open PVS Workspace](command:vscode-pvs.open-pvs-workspace)

pvs.pvsLibraryPath.description: PVS library path (colon-separated list of folders, e.g., usr/libs/L1:usr/libs/L2)

pvs.pvsWorkspaces.description: Default PVS workspaces folder (path is relative to your home folder; leave blank to disable the use of a default workspace)

pvs.serviceProvider.autocompletion.description: Autocomplete symbol names and language keywords (default: true)

pvs.serviceProvider.hover.description: Show hover tooltips for symbols (default: true)

pvs.serviceProvider.rename.description: Support for renaming of theories & formulas (default: true)

pvs.settings.authorKey.description: Personalized author key to be used in automatic annotations. Leave blank to use process.env.USER as author key.

pvs.settings.prover.@QED.description: Annotation @QED automatically added above a theorem after a successful proof attempt (default: true)

pvs.settings.proverConsole.autocompleteW.description: Use 'Enter' as alternate autocompletion key in the prover console (default: true)

pvs.settings.proverConsole.integratedHel.description: Number of integratd help lines visible in the prover console (default: 2)

pvs.settings.proverConsole.frequentComma.default: assert, beta, decompose-equality, expand, flatten, grind, hide, induct, lemma, match, postpone, replace, skeep, split, typepred, with-tccs
pvs.settings.proverConsole.frequentComma.description: Comma-separated list of frequent prover commands

pvs.settings.proverConsole.colorizeBrack.description: Enable colorization of matching parentheses pairs in sequent formulas (default: true)

pvs.xtras.enableAntlrParser.description: Enable ANTLR parser. Requires Java JDK v1.8 or greater (https://openjdk.java.net)

pvs.xtras.pvsioweb.widgetLibs.description: PVSio-Web Widget library files (colon-separated list of paths to pvsio-web widget library files).

languageServerExample.trace.server.description: Traces the communication between VS Code and the language server.

commands.title: Insert Prooflite Script at Cursor Position
Append new proof branch
commands.enablement: view == proof-explorer-view && viewItem != proof-branch && pvs-server-active == true

commands.title: Edit
commands.enablement: view == proof-mate-view && viewItem != proofmate-hint && viewItem != proofmate-hints

commands.title: Copy
commands.enablement: view == proof-explorer-view && pvs-server-active == true && viewItem != root

commands.title: Cut
commands.enablement: view == proof-explorer-view && pvs-server-active == true && viewItem != root

commands.title: Paste subtree
commands.enablement: view == proof-mate-view && viewItem != proofmate-hint && viewItem != proofmate-hints && proof-explorer.clipboard-contains-tree

commands.title: Run subtree
commands.enablement: view == proof-mate-view && in-checker == true && viewItem == proofmate-clip

commands.title: Fast forward here
commands.enablement: view == proof-explorer-view && viewItem != root && in-checker == true

explorer/context.when: resourceScheme == file && resourceExtname == .pvs && pvs-server-active == true || resourceScheme == file && resourceExtname == .tccs && pvs-server-active == true || resourceScheme == file && resourceExtname == .summary && pvs-server-active == true || resourceExtname == .pvs && editorLangId == pvs || resourceExtname == .hpvs && editorLangId == pvs
resourceScheme == file && resourceExtname == .pvs && pvs-server-active == true || explorerResourceIsFolder && pvs-server-active == true && editorLangId == pvs

view/item/context.when: view == workspace-explorer-view && viewItem == tcc || view == workspace-explorer-view && viewItem == theorem
view == workspace-explorer-view && viewItem == tcc || view == workspace-explorer-view && viewItem == theorem
view == proof-mate-view && viewItem != proofmate-hint && viewItem != proofmate-hints

view/item/context.comment: this is disabled as the icon can be easily confused with the play icon -- the user expects to be able to execute the command, but the function runs up-to the command

keybindings.note: edit proof command in proof explorer
one step back in proof explorer

scripts.postinstall: cd client && npm install && cd ../server && npm install && cd ..
